intro: Erica rakotozafyana, commonly known as the Madagascar heath, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heaths and heather. This species is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white, pink, or red. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions. Erica rakotozafyana plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to local biodiversity.
